meanings.definition: Able to change or be changed.
meanings.sent1: The weather in spring is very changeable.
meanings.sent2: She bought a changeable dress that can be worn in different ways.
meanings.sent3: The chameleon's changeable colors amazed the children at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: Her mood was as changeable as the wind, shifting from joy to sadness in an instant.
meanings.sent5: The changeable landscape transformed before their eyes, from lush green to barren desert.

meanings.sent1: The stock market is known for being changeable.
meanings.sent2: His plans are always so changeable, never staying the same for long.
meanings.sent3: The changeable nature of the cat's interest in the toy kept the owner entertained.
meanings.sent4: The political climate was as changeable as the weather, shifting opinions with each passing day.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's expectations were as changeable as the weather, constantly evolving throughout the semester.

meanings.definition: Capable of being altered or modified.
meanings.sent1: The design of the website is quite changeable.
meanings.sent2: The contract terms are changeable upon mutual agreement.
meanings.sent3: The changeable font size on the screen confused the users.
meanings.sent4: His changeable appearance made it hard to recognize him in a crowd.
meanings.sent5: The changeable settings on the camera allowed for versatile photography options.
